scenarios.output:
Create a new workflow template (workflow create)

USAGE workflow create [OPTIONS] <WORKFLOWID> <TITLE>

ARGUMENTS

  WORKFLOWID    Workflow ID to create              
       TITLE    Optional title for the workflow

ğŸ”§ GitVan Workflow Commands:
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ğŸ“‹ List workflows:
   gitvan workflow list

ğŸš€ Execute workflow:
   gitvan workflow run <workflow-id>
   gitvan workflow run <workflow-id> --input key=value
   gitvan workflow run <workflow-id> --dry-run

ğŸ”— Connect with Cursor CLI:
   gitvan workflow cursor <workflow-id> --interactive
   gitvan workflow cursor <workflow-id> --non-interactive
   gitvan workflow cursor <workflow-id> --model gpt-4

ğŸ“ Generate Cursor integration script:
   gitvan workflow cursor-script <workflow-id>

ğŸ” Validate workflow:
   gitvan workflow validate <workflow-id>

ğŸ“Š Show statistics:
   gitvan workflow stats

ğŸ“ Create workflow template:
   gitvan workflow create <workflow-id> [title]

â“ Show this help:
   gitvan workflow help

scenarios.scenario: Show main CLI help with workflow command
scenarios.output:
Git-native development automation platform (gitvan v3.0.0)

USAGE gitvan graph|daemon|event|cron|audit|hooks|workflow|jtbd|init|setup|save|ensure|pack|marketplace|scaffold|compose|chat

COMMANDS

        graph    Graph persistence and operations for GitVan                                                 
       daemon    Manage GitVan daemon (start, stop, status, restart)                                         
        event    Manage GitVan events (simulate, test, list, trigger)                                        
         cron    Manage GitVan cron jobs (list, start, dry-run, status)                                      
        audit    Manage GitVan audit and verification (build, verify, list, show)                            
        hooks    Manage GitVan Knowledge Hooks                                                               
     workflow    Manage GitVan Workflows                                                                     
         jtbd    Manage GitVan Jobs-to-be-Done (JTBD) Hooks                                                  
         init    Initialize GitVan project with Knowledge Hook Engine support                                
        setup    Complete autonomic setup: start daemon, install hooks, and auto-install packs (non-blocking)
         save    Save changes with AI-generated commit message and automatic job execution                   
       ensure    Ensure GitVan is properly configured in the repository                                      
         pack    Manage GitVan packs                                                                         
  marketplace    Browse and install packs from the GitVan marketplace                                        
     scaffold    Run a pack scaffold to generate content                                                     
      compose    Compose multiple packs together                                                             
         chat    AI-powered chat interface for job generation                                                

Use gitvan <command> --help for more information about a command.

scenarios.scenario: Handle missing workflow ID for run command
scenarios.output:
Execute a workflow (workflow run)

USAGE workflow run [OPTIONS] <WORKFLOWID>

ARGUMENTS

  WORKFLOWID    Workflow ID to execute    

OPTIONS

  --dry-run    Show what would be executed without actually running             
  --verbose    Show detailed execution information                              
    --input    Input parameters in key=value format (can be used multiple times)

scenarios.scenario: Handle missing workflow ID for validate command
scenarios.output:
Validate a workflow definition (workflow validate)

USAGE workflow validate [OPTIONS] <WORKFLOWID>

ARGUMENTS

  WORKFLOWID    Workflow ID to validate
